description.text:
On this advertisement poster, four differents advertisements for different companies/products can be seen:
The left upper section hosts an advertisement for Kiwi Dark Tanm showing a pair of polished shoes worn by a man in check pants. A detailed as well as a sample of the advertised product are pictured as well.
The right upper section showsd an advertisement for Lily Biscuits, depicting a sample of the biscuits being advertised as well as a baby child carrying a box of Lily Biscuits and smilng towards the viewer. "the pride of India" is written on the upper section of this ad with the condensation trail of an aeroplane. The background shows some trees, a lake as well as parts of a building on the right.
The lower left advertisement for Van Ingen & Van Ingen shelters the head of a lion.
On the lower right advertisement two personsn wearing uniforms can be seen as well as a logo with two lions. A of the products available as well as contact details are pictured as well.

inscription.text: "They've well worn - but they're worn well thanks to KIWI Dark Tan!"

No wonder they've worn well! Wouldn't any shoes, whose leather is daily nourished and cleansed pore-deep with Kiwi Polish! For Kiwi does more than give surface gloss to shoes; its fine, smooth wax preserves their youthful elasticity. Begin (f)eeding your shoes with Kiwi to-day.
- and, of course KIWI WHITE CLEANER in tube or block form for CANVAS & BUCKSKIN FOOTWEAR
Obtainable at all good stores throughout India, and Burma

DELICIOUS! is what you hear from everybody's lips when they try * LILY * CREAM CRACKER BISCUIS. They're rich, flaky, light and so delightfully short that they almost melt in your mouth like good pastry. For 'Chota' .. lunch .. afternoon tea, or whenever you are entertaining friends, LILY BISCUITS are always welcome. Obtainable in nicely decorated tins, as illustrated, or loose, from all good Dealers.
Manufactured by:- The Lily Biscuits Co., Calcutta & Bombay
VAN INGEN & VAN INGEN Artists in Taxidermy (...)(not readable)
Cables: "Geriart, Westcent, London." Phone: Temple Bar 1649
"DRUMS" Painting and Heraldry Sterling Silver Embroidery
Pipe Banners, Colour Belts, Drum Basses, Regimental Colours, Drum-Majors' Sahes, Etc. (General Military Catalogue on application)
36/39, West Street, Charing Cross Road, W.C.2, London England

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

description-en: On this advertisement poster, four differents advertisements for different companies/products can be seen:
The left upper section hosts an advertisement for Kiwi Dark Tanm showing a pair of polished shoes worn by a man in check pants. A detailed description as well as a sample of the advertised product are pictured as well.
The right upper section showsd an advertisement for Lily Biscuits, depicting a sample of the biscuits being advertised as well as a baby child carrying a box of Lily Biscuits and smilng towards the viewer. "the pride of India" is written on the upper section of this ad with the condensation trail of an aeroplane. The background shows some trees, a lake as well as parts of a building on the right.
The lower left advertisement for Van Ingen & Van Ingen shelters the head of a lion.
On the lower right advertisement two personsn wearing uniforms can be seen as well as a logo with two lions. A description of the products available as well as contact details are pictured as well. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: The company started as specialists in drums, fifes and bugles quickly establishing itself and soon diversifying into other areas of music and the Military. In 1817 Samuel was given the title Sergeant and Drum Major and later that year left the army to pursue his business full time immediately publishing his Manual for Drums, Fifes and Bugles. (from http://www.henrypotter.co.uk/about.htm, last accessed 2012-06-14) ()(gs)

The company started as specialists in drums, fifes and bugles quickly establishing itself and soon diversifying into other areas of music and the Military. In 1817 Samuel was given the title Sergeant and Drum Major and later that year left the army to pursue his business full time immediately publishing his Manual for Drums, Fifes and Bugles. (from http://www.henrypotter.co.uk/about.htm, last accessed 2012-06-14)
